snippet: The American staff sergeant suspected of killing 16 villagers has not been named or charged, and nothing has been disclosed about his state of mind.
abstract: American staff sergeant suspected of killing 16 Afghan villagers is flown to Kuwait from Afghanistan; he has not been named or charged and evidence has emerged that he acted alone; nothing has been disclosed about state of mind or any reasons for his actions.

byline.original: By JOHN H. CUSHMAN Jr. and GRAHAM BOWLEY
byline.contributor: John H. Cushman Jr. reported from Washington, and Graham Bowley from Kabul, Afghanistan. Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The American staff sergeant suspected of killing 16 villagers has not been named or charged, and nothing has been disclosed about his state of mind.

headline.seo: Suspect in Killing of Afghans Is Flown to Kuwait
headline.main: Suspect in Afghan Deaths Flown to Kuwait as Evidence Arises That He Acted Alone
headline.print_headline: Suspect in Afghan Deaths Flown to Kuwait as Evidence Arises That He Acted Alone
